intro: Acioa laevis, commonly known as the smooth acioa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or well-drained soils. Acioa laevis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
